DOC.brief_title: Implementation Impact Online Tool Used Primary Care Improve Income Security
DOC.detailed_description: Addressing social determinant health patient identify key way achieve health system goal . However , evidence-based intervention exist . This study emerge ongoing collaboration family physician , researcher charitable financial literacy organization . This study aim answer follow question : Is online tool address income security feasible acceptable clinician ? Can tool integrated regular clinic workflow ? What patient perspective tool short-term impact ? We recruit six primary care sit Toronto Winnipeg serve low-income community . We introduce clinician screen poverty increase access additional income source via government benefit . Following initial orientation session , health provider encourage use tool patient see . The health provider patient complete online tool together , generate tailored list financial benefit , along local community resource assist obtain benefit . A brief survey experience administer patient complete tool , well request contact one month . Those agree contact interview whether intervention impact knowledge ability access benefit . We administer online survey provider conduct provider focus group site end study . An advisory group make patient live low income representative community agency support study . An online tool could help health provider improve income security patient . Strengths study include involves diverse set clinic tool implement pragmatically , real world busy primary care clinic . Limitations include convenience sample method , select clinic may representative primary care provider relatively short follow-up period . Our finding provide insight potential electronic tool assist provider address social determinant health .
